snippet: Parole and police officers have been visiting freed convicted burglars in neighborhoods damaged by Hurricane Sandy, sending a message against looting in the storm’s aftermath.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column notes that New York City parole and police officers have been visiting freed convicted burglars in neighborhoods damaged by Hurricane Sandy, sending a message against looting in the storm’s aftermath.
lead_paragraph: Parole and police officers have been visiting freed convicted burglars in neighborhoods damaged by Hurricane Sandy, sending a message against looting in the storm’s aftermath.

headline.seo: Burglars Warned on Temptation of Looting After Storm
headline.main: Parolees Tempted by Cover of Blackout Are Warned
headline.print_headline: Parolees Tempted by Cover of Blackout Are Warned: Big Brother Is Watching
